newsitem.title: USA: Hormel, union negotiating at Ill pork plant.
newsitem.headline: Hormel, union negotiating at Ill pork plant.

text.p: Union officials and management at Hormel Foods Corp plant in Rochelle, Ill., were meeting Friday on a new labor contract, a company spokesman said.
"We do not anticipate a strike or work stoppage," said Allan Krejci, director of public relations.
"Our Rochelle people are meeting with union officials, otherwise it's business as usual," Krejci said.
The workers' contract reportedly expired last Sunday and there was talk of a possible strike if negotiations fail this weekend, a market source said.
Company officials and representatives of United Food and Commercial Workers Local 1540, which reportedly represents the plant employees, could not be reached for comment.
The plant in north central Illinois, has an estimated daily hog slaughter capacity of up to 7,000 head and employs about 600 people, industry sources estimated.
